title: Sampler, 1808
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, rococo, and eyelet stitches on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Mary Richards AEt 13 years Portland July 13 1808
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941, Museum for the Arts of Decoration of the Cooper Union
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description:
Four sets of alphabets and one set of numerals in the upper third; a verse and inscription in the middle third; and a landscape with large brick houses, trees, and sheep in the lower third. With a deep floral vine border. Embroidered in colored silks on a natural linen ground.
The verse reads:

Thy mercies fill the earth, O Lord,
How good thy works appear!
Open mine eyes to read thy word.
And see thy wonders there.

My heart was fashioned by thine hand.
My service is thy due:
O grant that I may understand
The duties I must do.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1808.
1808. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, rococo, and eyelet stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-13.
